{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3156907,"name":"Diego Lozano","username":"DiegoLol65","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/diegolol65/{size}/197351_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-04T04:29:13.629Z","cooked":"

We just flashed the Roborio2 3.2 image to a sd card, we turned it on and everything seemed normal. But when it came to setting our team number on the imaging tool, it didnt find any roborios nor it didnt gave any comms on the driverstation. We tested different cables, flashing the image again, using other computers, nothing.
We tested another roborio and it connected without any problems. Does anyone have any idea what could be happening?

I dont remember exactly what i did, but its solved now.
So yay, i guess

Ok so it’s starting to fail again, we can connect with the usb b cable directly to the RIO, but we cant connect wirelessly.
The ethernet ports seem to be sending data but when we connect to the network, it doesnt give any comms.

We had issues after we flashed the radio…took a few hours and about 3 orange hats to fix. We used an ethernet cable to the radio to get coms up again. Ran updates and everything that way for the rest of the game. We had always used the printer usb to do that…I think we ran the 3.1 during the competition this last weekend.
